ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to conduct my own research and put together a thesis based on a topic I chose.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not much advice from the Anthropology department. I had a great advisor but I've heard that other students felt pretty lost throughout the process.

There could be more guidance from the Anthropology department. The strengths depend on your advisor and how engaged they are. It's all super flexible and counts on you being dedicated to your project and meeting deadlines set by the department.
Could have used a bit more guidance, but I found my way eventually :)

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have a topic you want to explore independently and an advisor who will support you, then I highly recommend the yearlong senior thesis.
